answers.answer: You are feeling withdrawals it sounds like...i tapered and when u get this low u just dont feels good anymore...it is not enought to keep the withdrawals away completely but it is enough to keep u from completely detoxing off...when i started feeling that way during the taper i was very ready to take the days i needed and jump off....be done with them...and quit feeling so bad...BTW...u have been very disciplined to stick to a taper like that for this amount of time...congrats!
I am trying to figure out your daily dose. Is it 2.25 pills x 15mg?
yes a total of 2 full pills of 15mg and 1/4 pill of 15 mg.  Thanks for the post.  I am interested what you think of my problem GOing 2 make it
Basically I take 3 3/4 pills of 15 mg a day.  Each dose is around 11mg give or take

Exercise had been my savior.  God put a love of fitness in me long ago and now I know why.  Since I have been able to be serious in fitness again, my taper has went well.  I really just go to the gym anytime I get an urge. All and all I have been pretty good mentally.

You will start feeling the wd symptoms when you cut down. When you are taking 0 for the first day you will not feel good...just not as bad as ct. It's good that you've had some tests done and you don't have to worry about your liver and diabetes. Your lightheadedness could be due to a sudden change in blood pressure. Does it happen when you first stand up? I had a strange kinda pressure feeling in my head. Drug withdrawl is a physical illness and you won't feel good for a few days even with a taper. The good news is you will start to feel better. Just hang in there and try to tough it out during the first few clean days. There will still be mental stuff after the physical so keep posting and lean on us for support. You know where to find me if you need me Irish. Corey
Thanks alot corey for the advice.  I do need you all.  I don't feel this when I stand or sit or move quickly.  I feel it pretty much non stop for anywhere from thirty min. to a couple of hours.
jus hang in there...u have come a long way....like corey said..tapering is not pain free...hang in there and be safe

I have tried ct a few times only to give in to the hell.  But I think a these lower doses I am ready for CT.  I am going to give it a few more tapering days and focus everything on God, my family and exercise.  Thanks worried.

Sorry I took so long to get back to you. I see corey is helping you too. I agree that you are just feeling w/d. I would not recommend skipping he morning dose. It is better to space them throughout the day. You are getting close to being done. Maybe try 1/2s like 4 halves for several days ( spaced throughout the day) then 3 etc.

I have thought of the half thing and I think that is a good idea.  I recently seen a commercial about cigarette addiction talking about starting your day without one so I thought I would give that a try but I may try your suggestion instead.  Thanks GTMI.
The point to tapering is to get your body used to a lower dose. When you deprive it of the morning dose. It sets you up for w/d and cravings.

question: I am tapering down from as many as 9 30mg roxicodone a day.  I am six months in and I am now down to 2.25 15mg a day for the last three days.  My biggest obstacle now is starting the day without one.  I will be attempting that for the first time tomorrow.  My question is this.  I am lightheaded much of the day.  Especially after I have taken one and it is wearing off.  I feel like I have damaged myself.  Is this normal.  Do people get alot of lightheadedness.  I was calling it dizziness but the room don't spin, I just feel crazy.  I am 4.5 years in.  For 3 years I took normally 2 or 3 10 mg percocets a day for chronic back problems.  I am now 32 and I am done.  I know I am going to quit this.  But I am so worried that this craziness is going to stay.  Some days I do really good but some days it stays with me nearly all day.  Also even though I have not tested positive for diabetes problems, I had a really bad reaction to some pie the other day.  I had not eaten and I did overeat the pie no doubt so It may have just been a normal reaction but I got nausea and really lightheaded.  I thought I may have too much on my liver and it may have my sugar messed up.  I have had blood work done and my liver enzymes were great, and no sign of diabetes.  This is my secondary question, as the lightheadedness is my main concern.  Anyone who can help will be greatly appreciated.  By the way June 12 is it for me.  May God bless you all and me too!!!
title: Anyone out there to help?
